scousepy¶

Multi-component spectral line decomposition with scousepy. scousepy is a package for the analysis of spectral line data. A detailed description of the method (and the original IDL version of the code) can be found in Henshaw et al. 2016. In the following pages you will find a brief introduction to the method as well as a tutorial. The source code is available on GitHub and comments and contributions are very welcome.

Reporting issues and getting help¶

Please help to improve this package by reporting issues via GitHub. Alternatively, if you have any questions or if you are having any problems getting set up you can get in touch here.

Developers¶

This package was developed by:

  • Jonathan Henshaw

Contributors include:

  • Adam Ginsburg

  • Manuel Riener
